definition.name: Cycle_Notation
definition.definition: A cycle (a₁ a₂ ... aₖ) denotes the permutation σ ∈ Sym(Ω) defined by: σ(aᵢ) = aᵢ₊₁ for i = 1, ..., k-1, and σ(aₖ) = a₁. The elements a₁, a₂, ..., aₖ must be distinct elements of Ω. The cycle has length k. Cycles are composed right-to-left: (1 2)(2 3) means first apply (2 3), then apply (1 2). Two cycles are disjoint if they share no common elements. Disjoint cycles commute.
